Reviews.Title: “Kawada Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne T
Reviews.Content: I occasionally travel to LA on business in the downtown area and have returned to the Kawada each time. For my purposes, the location cannot be beat. Shopping is good and you can walk to the fashion district, Chinatown, Toy District etc. As a female traveler, I feel very safe here. There is plenty to do and see without having to deal with parking problems and expenses. After seeing my room, a coworker changed to this hotel. I have found the rooms I've been in to be clean, comfortable and functional, at a reasonable price - otherwise I would not have returned. There is a 24 hour Vietnamese restaurant next door and a daytime breakfast/lunch restaurant adjoining the hotel. You are 2 blocks (less then a 3 minute walk) to the Grand Market which is open daily until 6 pm - it is filled with a variety of food stands, fruit stands and a store where you can buy a variety of items - groceries, pots - pans and hygene items. The Hotel staff is excellent, and can communicate in several languages. When I had to set up an after hours meeting and needed privacy, they arranged for me to have a private room with a conference table and internet with no notice. All I can say if you are not happy with your room, let the staff know - I am sure they will fix the problem Negative items include the TV service, which can cut in and out at different times and the internet can take some "tweaking" to get it to work. When I had problems, hotel fixed my internet problems and did not charge me for the service my entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “What do you want from a hotel?”
Reviews.Author: ChosenN
Reviews.Content: It bothers me that people have been so negative about the Kawada Hotel. It is NOT the Hilton chain, or the Sheraton's chain - but, if I wanted that sort of hotel, I would go there. So, please when deciding on what sort of hotel you want don't rubbish the hotels that give you good service and are in an ideal spot (transport wise). True, the Kawada is looking tired, it is also true that the rooms are small, but they have a laundromat, ice machine, drinks machines, and an excellent "safe room" and the staff are terrific. No, they don't have the wonderful uniforms that the chains have, but, I am not looking at that. What I want from a hotel is a clean bed, a safe room (locks all work) and when I request something, I expect it done. That is what the Kawada has. The most appealing aspect of this hotel is that it is on the transport hub. All kinds of buses run 1 block from the hotel. Taxis, rail (right across the street), and seniors bus transport (for 25 cents American) to anywhere downtown. The "Alleys" is within walking distance, the Jewellery centre 2 blocks, and 2 blocks is the fruit and vegetable market - and what a wonderful display of food! As far as being in a safe area - I am travelling alone and I walk around at night in that area and I feel safe. I have not been mugged or questioned, and I am a senior. (Perhaps they feel sorry for me!). I will always stay at the Kawada and for the price - it is a real bargain. The staff are terrific. The problem that I see for the Kawada is that it has no restaurant (or coffee lounge). But there is a pizza place not far from there and the reception staff will give you a list of businesses that will bring in food (hot) for you.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: RaeRaeSama
Reviews.Content: First I arrived in the dead of night and even though I had a reservation, I was forced to pay for an extra day for 6 hours. Later that day I was moved to a different room and it was worst than the first. The "Double" room consisted of a single against one wall and a roll away shoved next to it which blocked the other side. I had to crawl onto the bed from the foot of it. Bathroom was kind of scary. Water leaked from the ceiling by the elevators. If you are young and need a place to crash...this is your spot. Up side...a refrigerator so I could store my fresh fruits and drink from the open market nearby. The market is awesome. Main street was nice and busy, the other side you should not venture on at night ...or the day for that matter. It is considered part of the Asian ghetto.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: The Kawada is located at the top of Hill Street at the corner of Hill and 2d. It is a block from the superior court and the county administration buildings, which makes it an ideal location if you have busness at either place. Two blocks the other way is the Ronald Reagan State Building, Two blocks up 2d is the Disney Concert Hall. It's a bit of a climb from the Kawada but worth a look. The rooms are reasonably priced and comfortable. The building was built in the early '20's and received a complete makeover in 1990. The old girl is starting to look like she could use a sprucing up, but the rooms are clean and the beds soft. When I started staying there in 1996, the hotel was nor near anything but fast food restaurants. Now there is a good pizza place and a good chinese retaurant both at 2d and Main, about three blocks away. A block down Hill Street is the Grand Central eating plaza which has several good stands with a convenience store on the Broadway side. There is valet parking. I gave the place only four stars because it is beginning to need a facelift, but it is a really good place to stay. The staff is really nice and helpful. All of the rooms have refidgerators. Many of the rooms have microwaves, and some have kitchenettes. There are fancier places to stay not too far away, but the Kawada is the best value. Since it is right at the corner of 2d & Hill, there is some traffic noise. If you are a litght sleeper, make sure you get an interior room. If you are a heavy sleeper like me, it doesn't matter. Rooms near the fire escapes have two windows, in case that matters.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz but comfortable and ideally located in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: girl_jo1970
Reviews.Content: My husband, 10yr old daughter and I stayed here for 9 nights. It was a small room with a double bed and rollaway bed for our daughter. Adequate, clean, dated accomodation, with fridge and over the tub, bath-shower. We found the location to be ideal for exploring in and around LA. However, the walls are thin and people coming and going at all hours, was a little off-putting. The staff were extremely friendly and obliging with any request we may have had. The small restaurant downstairs provides great meals, however isn't open after 4pm for dinner. There are more fast food and restaurants a block away should you need . I believe that the hotel is opening a Pho City restaurant very soon. There is only one computer in the lobby and I found that there were times that we were waiting for sometime to use it. No WiFi...only wired internet for a fee we were told. If you are requiring cheap, no-frills accomodation for a short stay, and don't have many expectations, this is a more than adequate stay. I wouldn't recommend it for families but great for singles and backpackers looking for basic, clean and central accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “worst place ever! the local park would be better”
Reviews.Author: Nathan M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kawada Hotel for 10 days, biggest mistake of my life! From the outside the hotel looks ok for the money, but as you get further in it get worse. Most of the staff are somewhat friendly. Now for the rooms, small and dirty, there is a dirty big A/c along side the bed, the fridge is about a 1960’s model, no tea or coffee making, however they do supply a ICE BUCKET AND 2 PLASTIC CUPS! That’s it. The TV is the size of a laptop screen and the ch drop out all the time. Only wifi in the lobby, no place to get a meal, there is a dodgy little bar around the corner but would not recommend, the café next door closes at 3pm, after 5pm you have to walk 4-7blocks for dinner. The fire alarms go off all night and the hotel porter walks the floors all night banging doors and talking on his phone! The location is great for subway, bus ect but that is the only plus this hotel has!

Reviews.Title: “Need the cheapest place to stay with average quality? Choose Kawada!”
Reviews.Author: bidou1983
Reviews.Content: It's surely not the best place you can find if you have the money, but it's cleary an average hotel if you want to stay in L.A. Downtown for only a couple of days. It's really near the Grand Central Market and you can go around (Hollywood, Santa Monica, Venice Beach) through Metro buses and subway easily. Sadly when we stay here it was during the E3 and everyone got the "High-speed" Internet connection so it was really slow to upload photos or download video from there during this special week. An alternative (for international traveler who's got a smartphone) is to buy a prepaid SIM card and get a Web daypass for 1,50$ (illimited access and it works better than the Kawada Internet connection). The kitchenette was ok since it contains only a fridge and a sink. I have to notice that one day before we leave the room wasn't clean by the maid... but we was able to get new towels from the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish.”
Reviews.Author: SenorSpielbergo
Reviews.Content: Sorry, this place was rubbish. The smoke alarm went off twice in the middle of the night because the bar next door was cooking something. I don't cheap and easy places, but we had a horrible stay.

Reviews.Title: “Canceled my reservation, was charged anyway!”
Reviews.Author: immolari
Reviews.Content: I had a federal jury summons down in L.A. and I thought about staying at this hotel, since it was blocks from the courthouse, so I made an online reservation. Changed my mind the next day and canceled the reservation with over 30 days until the scheduled stay. They charged me anyway. I called the phone number in my cancellation email and was told that the confirmation number didn't sound like theirs. I asked to speak to a manager who informed my that "somehow the reservation got duplicated and only one was canceled" right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in new "old" L.A. Downtown”
Reviews.Author: jamwood
Reviews.Content: 2nd time we bedded down in this hidden treasure. I grew up in L.A. area, where the general attitude was: any place but - ack! - downtown, yuk! Now I live out of state and have rediscovered the renewed downtown Los Angeles as a visitor. The Kawada, on the periphery of beautiful Japantown, is in the middle of everything: the restored Angel's Flight (steep trolley up to the top of Bunker Hill), the classic Union Station, fast & frequent bus and rail lines to everywhere (like beaches, etc.), Chinatown, Olvera Street, and the exciting, venerable Grand Central Market (Mercado Central). All of these and more for prices well geared to the strapped traveler. The Kawada is safe, clean, super-friendly, everything upgraded and in fine working order. Rooms are small but low in cost.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not sure this place passed inspection”
Reviews.Author: Klrobinson
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this place is horrible.I wouldn't recommend it to anyway. I'm a college student and I am in no way used to splendor but sheesh.. This place was so old run down, and reeking of a nursing home I hate that it's the place I chose to stay four nights in. The kitchenette is gross and the mini fridge is not sanitary, cold, or packed with pricey goodies. My friend and I took a trip around the corner and bought a bottle of disinfectant spray and two fleece blankets to take the place of the linens they gave us. The undercover was burnt all over with maybe cigarette burns or something else. Honestly I hate it and i would never recommend it... Ever. Ps. It is nicely located a block from the Civic Center But the neighborhood is quite sketchy.

Reviews.Title: “Best.Hotel.Ever...”
Reviews.Author: TonySolomun
Reviews.Content: Whenever I am in Los Angeles the first and only choice I choose is to stay at the Kawada Hotel,why ? simple,the rates are low and reasonable,and the amenities are fantastic,cheap internet access,spacious rooms,and hte fact that there are the comforts of a home within a hotel,microwaves,fridges,cable TV,what have you, and the main part for my staying there,which I have done so is the location,right in the heart of downtown LA, and is within walking distance of the nearest metro train station and metro buses, put simply,this is the hotel to stay at if you are in Los Angeles,I give it my highest possible recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: pamparapoodle
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at this hotel for a night during November, and it was AWFUL!! we arrived at 7.30pm and the hotel foyer appeared a little run down. we were given keys to our room and directions on how to find it. we had booked a twin room and I guess thats what we got, BUT! The room was tiny, the carpet was very stained, the bin had not been emptied and the shower was covered in mildew. There were no tea/coffee making facilities, so we rang down to order room service, but none is available, we asked where we could get a drink and were told that none were available within walking distance of the hotel. so after a 10 hour flight we had to wait a further12 hours before we could get a drink! The lift broke down and everyone had to use the service lift, and the reception staff were anything but helpful. Having travelled extensively, this is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't stay for 5 minutes.”
Reviews.Author: TravelCoordinatorPH
Reviews.Content: On the busiest night in Los Angeles where every hotel was booked within a 10 mile + radius, the Kawada had rooms available. The reservation was for one person that just wanted to be close to court for an appearance the next morning. I looked at reviews before making the reservation and was very hesitant to do so. The attorney said she was not fussy and just needed a place to sleep. I went ahead and booked the room for her. She checked in and ran out screaming once she saw the room. She told me she absolutely could not stay there. They attempted to make a queen size bed by pushing two twins together. Half of it was made, the other was not. The sheets appeared to be dirty. The room did not smell good. The room was so small that this petite woman could barely walk around the bed. The rate was $109 per night. She said she would not have even paid $20 per night for this kind of room. Of course, the cancellation policy is 24 hours in advance so they said that we would be charged for the room. We had to speak to the general manager, John Marko, to request a refund. He defended the hotel saying it was completely booked and that every other guest found it satisfactory enough to stay. He said there is a roll away twin underneath and that is why the beds were formed like that. He kept saying it is the canellation policy and we are going to be charged regardless. I told him I understand that is the policy and asked him to make an exception due to the experience the guest had. I was not confrontational and tried to reason with him, but he was obviously annoyed and began raising his voice. Again, I understand it is the policy and we have to deal with it. But his level of professionalism is questionable. As is this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “its okay during the day”
Reviews.Author: Tashie09
Reviews.Content: they hotel is nice... they staff are very friendly and very helpful.. they only down side is, its not a safe feeling at night time due to the amount of homeless, also if you get if after 5pm theres not alot open so if your hungry you kinda stuck.. the rooms where small, no coffee or tea making items.. beds were hard i woke up with back pains and im only 19.. subway was in walking distanace and only 1.50 one way to catch it, but the people were a bit creepy.. otherwise not too bad to stay for a short period of time

Reviews.Title: “probably wouldnt recommend”
Reviews.Author: tahlz22
Reviews.Content: the biggest downfall for this hotel is location, it sucks. based in downtown where everything shuts after 5pm, which means you have to catch the subway (dodgy) to the staples centre area or hollywood if you want to dine out of hit the town etc. on the up side the staff were very helpful with telling us how we could catch the subway & where was good to head to for food but i deffinatley wouldnt stay there again simply based on its poor location. the rooms are pretty sad, but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: NR89
Reviews.Content: The Kawada is FANTASTIC! I stayed there with my Mum and my Brother, who's 6'3, for 7 nights and we found it comfortable, a great location and the staff were very helpful. The rooms are small, we got a bit of a shock but after we settled in it was fine, we had 2 single beds then a rollaway. We actually took the matress off and my brother just slept on it on the floor and we rolled it up in the morning.. The hotel is less then 100m away from the subway from which you can get to Hollywood, Universal City and Long Beach. We got a day ticket which was $5. When we wanted to get to Santa Monica we asked the front desk and they directed us to a bus stop 3 blocks away that cost us $1.25 each and got us all the way to the Pier.. The Downtown area iitself was great, there was a convienience store about 2min away, there was an amazing Italian Restaurant 2 blocks away and a very good cafe right next to the hotel. I really can't praise it enough, I will definately be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't stay the whole time let alone go back”
Reviews.Author: aussiesweets
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked this hotel for me and although the hotel itself isn't too bad, it is old but what i expected considering what i paid. The staff were friendly, and seemed interested enough in helping out. The location, however, was horrible. If you are in LA for the first time or to enjoy the sights i recommend you do not stay here. A taxi fare from the hotel to Hollywood was $40, i could not for the life of me find a mini mart or pharmacy and nobody could point me in the right direction. The guy at the desk told me that i shouldn't leave the hotel at night, or go to some of the surrounding areas as i was female and alone, which made me feel quite unsafe. i spent a night there and although i had prepaid for another 3, i left and spent the remainder of my time in a hostel which felt alot safer and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, no food in the area”
Reviews.Author: babiesquuensland
Reviews.Content: Hotel not bad, old and a bit tired, overall the staff helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. The rooms were fairly clean and had everything required except tea and coffee falicities. There is a really bad lack of food choices in the hotel and general area. I don't think that as a single person I would walk around the area of a night and too eat you have to leave the hotel. Anyone considering the hotel would need to consider this.

Reviews.Title: “Kawada Hotel, LA”
Reviews.Author: MartijnG3
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in downtown LA, near Chinatown. Location is very good however the hotel is not that good. Room I had was very small. We were unable to place our luggage and when we managed to do so we were unable to climb out of the bed or walk around in the room; Our room had cooking facilities however no materials to cook in. Hotel has no restaurant (as fare as I know of) and we had to buy our breakfast our self somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: holmesa1024
Reviews.Content: A group of us went to LA for NYE and since we booked a hotel last minute, the Kawada was just about the only thing available. Now I know why. From the lobby the hotel looks decent but then we went upstairs. First room we saw was the double bed room. It was about the size of a closet and had two twin beds in it. I could not believe my eyes. I wasn't exactly sure how four grown adults were supposed to fit into a closet with twin beds, but they managed since it was only one night and there was basically no other choice. then we opened our full sized bed room and it was pretty much the same thing with a full bed. The decor was awful. Seems like they have been using the same comfortors for the past 20 years and the pillows were so uncomfortable. I have never laid down and got a headache from a pillow before. Then I tried to turn on the tiny flatscreen tv and it did not have any working channels. We called the front desk and they gave us some possible options to get it to work but still no channels. So once again we called the front desk to have them send someone up and they said they were really busy but they would try to get to our room. Needless to say, nobody ever came. The only good thing I can say about the hotel was that it was pretty clean and it was in a good location for where we wanted to be. But I don't care if I have to sleep in my car next time but the Kawada will never see me again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Casi26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ferral to say the least. i booked this hotel through a travel agent.....BIG MISTAKE! I cant explain the smell....you feel like your suffocating on the smell...its throughout the entire hotel and it got through my suitcase so my clothes stank of the hotel for the remainder of my trip!yuck. Its in a bad location and not very safe. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A different experience”
Reviews.Author: rodeoaussies
Reviews.Content: We thought the staff were excellent and listened to what you had to say and helped in every way possible. The rooms were clean and tidy but they could have had a coffee machine somewhere in the hotel as it was hard to find a coffee late at night . Location was a bit isolated if u are from another country , as we where travelling in a group we soon found our way around thanks to the staff of the hotel for pointing us in the right direction . The best part of staying at the kawada was the staff had no problems with the noisy children playing in their foyer boy where they noisy!!!!!!!!! not to say the same for the adults of our group i think they were worse. We really didnt find any problems there ,just that after getting home from a late night out it would have been nice to have a coffee machine somewhere in the hotel as the restaurant closed very early next door.A big thank you to all the staff for making our stay enjoyable . Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: JeMeDa
Reviews.Content: We were orginally booked in for 3 nights and only lasted one. The service from the front desk was ok and when you first check in the hotel looks ok, however the area it is in leaves a lot to be desired. Our travel agent booked us in as it was close to the Metro. When we arrived in the roome there was a horrible smell, tit was was dirty and the sheets were not something I wanted to sleep in. The bathroom was ok. After a 20 hour flight all we wanted was sleep so decided to stay the night, on checking out my husband explained why we were leaving early, the front desk did not care and the girl serving him virtually ran away, I am sure she has heard his reasons many times.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend KAWADA because I'm stereotyped, Japanese guy of Cleanliness!”
Reviews.Author: asiantherapist
Reviews.Content: Actually the size of rooms is very small for average Americans. Maybe right for Japanese!? ^^ And you do not have many staffs working for you since the management is cost efficient. And good restaurants are away. And a few homeless people walking once in a while on Hill street where the hotel is located. In summer time, open doors out of emergency stairways. However ! This property has no crime 20 years, I mean since the owner has purchased this property and remodelled building as hotel, I heard. Five story old building has no bugs inside. Isn't it very funny? The cleanliness is much much better than five star hotels such as Ritz Carlton, GrandHyatt, etc, because of good housekeeping staffs, and because the top management people is, like TOYOTAs/HONDAs, stepping down to the level of staffs and talks with them; which US auto makers would not do. I am running medical clinics in Tokyo Metro area, hiring 20 doctors, so sort of cleanfobic? And I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was a dump in bad isolated location”
Reviews.Author: Agro_Sydney
Reviews.Content: I booked the Kawada before I did research on the Web which was a big mistake. Gave them the benefit of the doubt. I booked through an Aussie travel agent and the brochure for the Kawada looked good . It was cheap and we got a free nights accomodation included in the deal. The rooms are tiny, drab and depressing, the bathroom was OK. It needed the kitchenette to be ripped out, a coat of white paint and new carpet, beds and light fittings. It would be a good place to put a Formule 1 Hotel. the desk and chair took up half the room. Although it was close to the the Metro, it was miles from any restaurants. There was a McDonalds about a block away in Broadway, it was filthy and full of homeless people. We existed on snickers bars from the vending machine because it was such an isolated location after dark. If I went to LA again, I would stay in Hollywood, Beverley Hills , Venice, Santa Monica or Anaheim. I would not stay more than 2 nights at the Kawada hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Nice, In the Heart of LA”
Reviews.Author: superstarintheworld
Reviews.Content: We went in holiday in LA for the second time in our lives, in June, and we stayed at the hotel Kawada for a week, we chosed it because it is cheap. It's a nice hotel, with nice bedrooms, clean, quite nice staff, it was very close to the subway Civic Center well linked with the most interesting places of LA such as Universal Studios, Hollywood, etc...the hotel is in Downtown but is not close to something in particular, beside the Disney Concert Hall that you can reach with a short walk. It has a beautiful view on the skycrapes of the town. When we went there, they had no restaurant and there was none close to it, also because in the evening is not a too sure place, there are strange people and is not raccomandable, above all for girls alone. Anyway, if you want to don't spend so much money, you can stay there, if you do not expect too much from a hotel. Anyway, we suggest you to stay there only if you already have been in LA or know it very well, because the staff is not so helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate is a compliment”
Reviews.Author: tvnewseditor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kawada because my husband was attending a conference at the LA Convention Center and this was one of their "designated hotels." We should have known what we were in for since the hotel was the least expensive one on the convention list. It must have been a converted long-term stay motel because our room had a stainless steel sink and laminate countertop across from the bed. There was a vent fan above the countertop, indicating there was a stove/oven in the room at some point. The room was incredibly dingy, poorly lit, and small. The bedding was a scratchy comforter and white sheets. Nothing fancy, but they were probably the best part of the room. The convention rate included free in-room Wifi, but the wall-mounted Wifi panel fell apart in our hands (although the connection still worked) when we touched it. Our bathroom wasn't huge, but it had everything we needed. It also had a huge wall-mounted shelf (supporting our extended stay theory). The shower was sufficient, although the water temperature would suddenly and drastically change (from hot to hotter) while I was showering. We had a rental car which was valet parked for $13/night. I think they parked it at a secure lot next to the hotel, but I'm not sure. There was an inexpensive public pay lot less than a block from the hotel, but it wasn't secure and we didn't feel safe leaving our car there. The hotel is actually pretty well located right off CA 110, and it was easy to get to I-5 as well. It rarely took us more than 20 minutes to get where we were going, but we were mostly driving at off-peak times. This hotel isn't really in a great location in terms of exploring the city on foot, although if you go about a mile away down the road, there's a pretty fancy shopping area. One block behind the hotel was a cluster of fast food places, but there is no convenience store, drug store, or other place to buy toiletries anywhere within a couple blocks' walking distance. The staff were perfectly nice and helpful, although it's not the type of place where they'd make restaurant reservations for you. The valet was very nice, although when we called ahead to have our car brought around, it took them 10 minutes to bring it. Overall, I would not recommend the Kawada unless you like hotels that are just a couple steps above camping.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: greg_rows_boats
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Kawada Hotel in Los Angeles was okay but not all that great. The staff were courteous, and the rooms were in good shape. However, if you are looking to stay there for business, I must caution that the windows are not well insulated for sound, so if you're a light sleeper, chances are that you might wake up from the buses and emergency vehicles that may pass by the hotel overnight. In essence, if you are okay with staying in a small room with inadequate windows, then it's a possible place to stay at. Advantages: * Courteous Staff * Clean Rooms * Laundromat On-site * Location to Downtown LA and Civic Center Disadvantages: * Antiquated Rooms * No iron / ironing board * Poor sound insulation to outdoor environments * Use of punch-card keys and not magnetic swipe card keys * Lack of in-room safe for securing valuable items

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: bellovesnyc
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Kawada for one week on our honeymoon and it wasnt too bad. Positives were a vending machine on one of the levels, free internet access twice a day for 10 mins, staff were mostly nice to us, willing to help out with booking for tours etc which was cool, clean rooms, cleans sheets, a really big bathroom and the cherry pick cafe next door was ACE! negatives were, bit of an old feel to the place, bit dated, no access to stairs- you have to use an elevator which sucks when you hate the bloody things like i do!!!, the hotel was far from tourist attractions and seemed to be a dead end side of town. overall, could have been worse so it was ok for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “WASTE Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nspa
Reviews.Content: We stayed the hotel for one day. in that hotel, only the manager and one room boy is there. no one is there for if u want any help..if u touch anything in the room, it'll fell off.....better dont touch anything..... .we called the manager to tell that water is coming not in the room... they told us they'll change the room...we told ok...but for half an hour we waited...but no one respond.....so we called once again.........no response.....then we tried the pipe once again......atlast we got the water......moreover they'll charge extra money also,if paid online itself...but they charged extra money also.....

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: rachPerth
Reviews.Content: We lasted one night in the Kawada. We arrived in the evening were told there was no food within the Hotel. We were told to walk down 2nd Street to find some. There was nothing open and a police car stopped to tell us it wasnt safe to walk around at night in the area, My experience was it wasnt all that good during the day either. The room was dirty and when I pulled back the bed covers it was obvious the sheets hadnt been changed. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful but there was little they could do to change the frightening location or the sheer lack of facilities offered. The web site had indicated there were two restaurants in the hotel and the photos of the rooms were so far from what was there that I wonder if it was even the same hotel. We moved to another Hotel in Hollywood which was in a much better location.

Reviews.Title: “OK - dont stress if youve already booked it.”
Reviews.Author: katysmith101
Reviews.Content: hmmmmmm, a bit of a strange one, staying in downtown is not really helpful - staying near hollywood boulevard would have been better. Had to pay $15 per day extra for Parking - so would have preffered to use that money for a better location, and you have to use the valet. Staff a bit distant, but would help if we asked. Not a very good location, but good for catching the metro - which we did most days. Nothing special like a pool or fitness room. Could use a communal computer for checking emails (1 for whole hotel). To be honest, wouldnt recommend. But it was clean and safe, and that was our requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic”
Reviews.Author: Cathal M
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly if you need help don't be afraid to ask. the hotel is find if you just want a bed to sleep on at night as the room is basic but clean. you have to requst for your bed sheets to be changed as if you don't they wont but your towels that you leave on the bathroom floor will be replaced everyday. if you are looking for a quite hotel or a lie in i would not recommend it as when i was there there was building work going on and they start monday-saturday at about 7/730 each morning. it is a good hotel if you want to explore Los Angeles as you are a 5/10 minute walk from the metro station at either 4th street or Pershing square which will take you to different stations or to places of intrest e.g. Universal city (Universal Studios) or Hollywood and Highland (Hollywood). the hotel has 2 resturant, one was not opened at all for my stay (10days) and the other was only opened once. At night time I would not recommend walking around downtown where the hotel is situated by your self as there is alot of homeless people on the streets. overall the hotel is an ideal place to stay if you are just looking for a place to catch a few hours sleep ideal for travellers, business people only staying for a nite or two or for young people who will be using it as a base.

Reviews.Title: “the worst”
Reviews.Author: sarahdot
Reviews.Content: this was an awful, 80's hotel in the worst location. although the room was clean enough, it was absolutely tiny. could have put up with this if it wasnt for the, frankly frightening area it was in. we had booked up for 9 nights (and paid) but only managed 4 nights before cutting out losses and paying for a different hotel on venice beach. this cost us a lot of money, which just shows how awful it was. downtown LA is horrific. i am not easily scared but i wouldnt even go to theshop on the corner of the street by myself. and the parking costs were a total rip off. NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oh_to_travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Kawada as it seemed like it would be close to the attractions in LA while we were on our holiday for 5 days. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted OK. The reception area was very 1970/80's. We were told that we had to pay for parking ($15+tax per night!). My husband was not pleased, as we never have never had to pay for parking at any other hotel we have stayed at before. The room was a SHOEBOX. It was so tiny, it just fitted the double bed in it, a small desk with a crappy old tv on it, and a small sink with a non-working fridge underneath. The blinds needed replacing as the light from the street light shined through. The worst thing about our room was that it was opposite from a demolishion site. Every morning at 7am (on the dot!) we were awoken by noisy trucks, large bangs, etc. Overall, the bedroom and the bathroom were clean enough to stay there and it was relatively cheap, but we won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: moonies
Reviews.Content: Arrived 12th Dec 06....First night we were worried about tge location but it was well lit up so not too bad. The room we initially got was a bit noisy as it was facing the main road, so we asked to be moved on the next day which the staff were happy to offer us a different room, although it had 2 singles we were still happy. The staff at this hotel were very helpful and would go out of their way to get info to make sure we got to places we wanted to visit. Downtown isn't a place I would go back to but if I had to I would stay at the Kawada.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: NcSt
Reviews.Content: We didnt have a car in LA so the location was very convenient, just one block from the metro and bus stop. Located in the downdown you can even walk to convention center. The room and the bath was extremely small but okay if u r just sleeping there and not spending any more time. There was a kitchenette but the fridge was very old. All in all it was an OKAY hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: SLOchik
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled for Federal Jury Duty, and this is one of the hotels on thier referral list. For someone that is not familiar with the Downtown LA area, parking was a headache. It's not very well marked where individuals should park for valet parking (there is only "Taxi Parking Only" signs in front of the hotel). When I contacted the front desk to ask where I was to go (since there is numerous parking garages around there but none that obviously if for the Kawada Hotel, the staff was quite rude. The front desk staff (a single individual) was quite short too. The valet staff on the other hand were definately thier strong point. They were open to any questions and openly gave me recommendations and tips on how to get around safely since I was out of my element. The Hotel and room were clean, so that was the one thing I could not complain about. The "amenities" in the room were at a bare minimum and VERY outdated. Anything that could make noise, did, and on a regular basis. Between the street traffic, the various appliances, and the plumbing, I didn't sleep more that a few hours that night. If I go back.. I won't be staying here. Also, the restaraunt that is next door, is very nice but also very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising hotel in downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: seadog59
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned traveler finding a good hotel in a downtown metro area is usually an expensive proposition however I have stayed on several occasions at the kawada hotel in los angeles and have been pleasantly surpirsed on each visit. A japanese styled hotel that is located downtown is within a block of the metro and the rooms are clean and comfortable to say the least. The hotel staff go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and greet you by name. For only 79 dollars this is a great deal for a clean, safe and relaxing way to see los angeles.

Reviews.Title: “wished I'd researched before our trip”
Reviews.Author: Toowoombatourist
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel under the advice of our travel agent. The usual places she preferred were booked so she chose this one.To be fair, our criteria was clean and close to public transport and I guess it did fit the bill in the last respect at least! When we arrived on the airport shuttle bus we were a little worried by the area but didn't think too much of it - how bad could it be! The foyer of The Kawada is reasonably nice ( though slightly smelly) and the staff were helpful when approached on where to eat etc. The rooms were a definite disappointment - no view except a wall,very small and dated, quite dark and very few of the usual extras. As this was our first night on our U.S. holiday I was beginning to worry! We chose to walk down to a market we were told about to buy lunch but were truly unprepared for the area we found ourselves in.We stood out in the crowd and attracted a lot of attention from beggars and homeless people.I certainly didn,t feel safe enough to walk anywhere at night for food etc . We stayed here the day after Thanksgiving and the restaurant was closed. The coffee shop next door was great for breakfast though and very friendly and prompt with their service. In retrospect, we should have cut our losses and moved after the first night and our memories of L.A. may have been less effected by a quite poor hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected after reading the reviews here”
Reviews.Author: atlantaq26
Reviews.Content: The neigborhood issues are vastly overstated. Ritzy Omni Hotel one block (and a steep hill) away. Also one block away, a thriving, bustling, inner city Latino community. Payless, RiteAid, Subway, KFC, Taco Bell. et al. There ARE the homeless and street people, but, by far and away, many more families, mothers and children, teens and seniors...people just living their lives. I walked about extensively and never felt threatened.or noticed. As almost everything in downtown LA closes at 6:00, there really is not much reason to be out downtown after dark. Even if you're at The Marriott, Wyndham, Omni or Holiday Inn, there are few places to walk to, so, does it really matter all that much? Just one block down the street is the internationally flavored and exotic indoor public market, ("an institution since 1917") where a staggering variety of freshly grown, fried, cooked and baked foods are available at lower prices than you'll see anywhere. Forget about convenience stores. There is a standard 7-11 about a mile or two down Figueroa (too far to comfortably walk) and although "scary" is an extreme description of the local convenience stores...it's not totally out of line. The shelves are generally fairly bare...with an odd-lot mix of products that makes me wonder how they survive. My own prize-winning Snapple cap that won me two free bottles, purchased July 06, sadly had to have been redeemed in 2005. There's lots of cheap parking is available close by (no pun intended). For conventioneers, the aforementioned Omni, a 10 minute walk away, is often a shuttle-bus stop for shows at The Convention Center, which is a $7 cab ride away. I paid $74 a night, plus $10 daily for hi-speed internet. The complaint about the internet connection is quite valid. The VERY HELPFUL AND FRIENDLY (!!!) front desk staff acknowledged that you had to stand by the headboard of your bed to connect to the short cable provided. The front desk provided me with a connector and an 8' cord. It still only reached the end of the bed, but at least I was able to sit while computing. I can't imagine why the cabling, along wth 2 of the light switches, were installed in the headboard that way....and why they haven't further addressed the issue. If you're coming and plan to connect and spend time online, bring your own 12-15' cable. Caveat emptor. The Lobby and front area are nice. Hallways not cooled. Yuck. 2 Well-stocked and reasonably priced vending machines. Small rooms, ...no seating area save the desk. While there were some signs of wear (and a picture was hung upside down) the room was clean and maintained. The small bathroom was very clean, with towels that were more plush than I expected. Authentic Shower-Massage head in the stall. There is a coffee-maker, small refrigerator and sink and STOVE...but no utensils, pots, pans or plates Bring 'em if you plan on using the kitchenette. Public microwave on the mezzanine level. Standard beds and bedding and a window mounted heating-cooling unit...all of which were no better, noisier or worse than most.. Really is best for business travellers on a budget. After all is said and done, having been here...I would return....but it might not be my first choice. It's a good value for the money, given the price of the alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of thought went into making you miserable”
Reviews.Author: Mean_Ogre
Reviews.Content: Everything at this hotel is designed to make the guests absolutely miserable. Forget about such incidentals as skid row location, dirty rooms, "unobtrusive" service, lack of closets and irons and a 20-year old TV. Torture by design goes further than that. On one side of the room there is a "desk" with power outlets but the phone and internet are across the room at a little cabinet. The cords are too short to even allow using the laptop while seating on the bed (you have to kneel before the cabinet to use the internet). No bath, no towel bar (towels have to be "discarded" after each use because there is no way to hang them). Bed seems to have a plastic liner that makes your back wet. Horrible smell throughout the hotel. $160 per day is definitely a rip-off (I've stayed at much better hotels/motels for $60 per day). Pessimist would say it can't get any worse than this.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: 30yo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there during interviews for new jobs in a new city. I really think that my bad experience there made us not even consider the positions in that city. Once we arrived there was no one at the front to tell us where to park. The lobby reaked of cigarette smoke (and i'm allergic) - they allowed smoking in the lobby. Once we got upstairs things were even worse. The phone didn't work and the room smelled like bad cleaning products. The iron was broken so we couldn't iron our suits for the interviews..... I slept with a towel wrapped around my pillow because it wasn't clean. There was no where within walking distance where we could go grab something to eat. We thought we could sit on a hill close by and then noticed that everyone around us was stoned or drunk in the middle of the day. I would never go to kawada inn again and might even rather sleep at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, Unsafe Location”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel whilst on an adventure across America by myself last year. The hotel itself is ok, The rooms are very basic and the staff are polite enough but......Be aware that Downtown LA is like a scene out of a gangsta movie! Panhandlers and Derelicts constantly harrass you for money, and the whole area has a high risk of muggings. My advice is book tours during the day, Don't venture out at night unless you absolutely have too! And order in (The hotel can provide you with local delivery places!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After viewing the hotel's website, we felt it sounded like the ideal place for us, especially at the price. However, after reading the reviews here we had second thoughts! HOwever, after a fair bit of research on other hotels we decided to split our time in LA between 2 hotels to lessen the risk and to see different parts of the city, which turned out to be an excellent idea. We spent 4 nights at the Kawada and we were quite happy with it, although their website's claim of "a luxurious experience" is a little optimistic! THe location is excellent for getting around Downtown LA. We were able to walk to the Staples Center and some shops, although LA is not great for shopping. Our room was small but did not feel claustrophobic (although had we stayed there later in our trip it may have felt more so). THe bed was ok, the TV did not have a great picture but had a good selection of channels. The bathroom was small and not particularly homely, but clean. We had a corner room which meant windows on two walls, which gave us more light but also more noise. DOwntown LA is quite noisy at night. We had trouble sleeping on our first night mainly due to being over-tired from a very long journey, and we were very aware of all the sirens and traffic. That was a saturday night and subsequent nights were quieter. Service was ok. We had mistakenly believed that a complimentary breakfast was included in the price, but after eating at the deli next door it transpired that this was not the case. However, the hotel were good enough to pay for that day's breakfast for us. As the room had a fridge we bought fruit juice and cereal of our own and ate in our room for the rest of our stay. The hotel is nothing to write home about, but as long as you have realistic expectations about your stay (it is not a luxury hotel!) and about being in Downtown LA I don't see why you should be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, would suit business men on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Chester100
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel before leaving Australia from a travel brochure based on the reasonable price, and promise that it was great value and close to all the action. Our first night in LA was at a 4 star hotel in Hollywood, then we moved to this. What a contrast! The hotel borders the central business disctrict and the only "attractions" are high-brow music halls and the Museum of Contemporary Arts. Other than that, you will need to engage public transport to do anything exciting. Do not venture down nearby Main St as it is very scary! Unfortunately this downtown area has more than its fair share of homeless people calling it home, and because the street are often otherwise deserted, you do feel very conspicuous walking around searching for a convenience store (there aren't too many!). Rooms are small and the decor is dated (very 80s). Our window had a nice view of a brick wall. The shower wasn't too powerful, and overall the bathroom didn't feel too clean. The service was reasonably polite but not particularly helpful. For travellers unfamiliar with LA and want a bit of excitement, don't stay downtown. Business travellers on a tight budget would find this suitable.
